entry.title: Thoughts On the New Arcade Fire (The Lightning I & II)

media:group.media:title: Thoughts On the New Arcade Fire (The Lightning I & II)
media:group.media:description:
► Here's a quick video in which I discuss my thoughts on the new 2-part Arcade Fire song, Lightning I & II. Following 2017's controversial Everything Now, fans were unsure of the direction the band would go in. Now, a new record entitled "WE" is slated for a May 6th, 2022 release. On March 17th, this new track dropped and here are my brief thoughts.
► Leave a like if you enjoyed! Also, subscribe to the channel! ► TWITTER: https://twitter.com/lifesurrealband ► INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/shawn.pc/?hl=en ► More music related content coming soon here on The Music Narrative

entry.title: Shed Your Skin | The Story of Title Fight

media:group.media:title: Shed Your Skin | The Story of Title Fight
media:group.media:description:
► Title Fight is one of the most recognizable names in the world of heavier music today. Having released quintessential albums such as Shed (2011), Floral Green (2012) and Hyperview (2015), the band has developed a die-hard fanbase. Fronted by Ned Russin (of Glitterer), this is the story of the group, from their humble beginnings in 2003 to present day, in which the band's future is uncertain.
Also a huge thank you for 3,000 subscribers, very much appreciated!
► Leave a like if you enjoyed! Also, subscribe to the channel! ► TWITTER: https://twitter.com/lifesurrealband ► INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/shawn.pc/?hl=en ► More music related content coming soon here on The Music Narrative

entry.title: Arlington Sunset | The Story of Calm

media:group.media:title: Arlington Sunset | The Story of Calm
media:group.media:description:
► In this week's video, I discuss Calm, a rock band formed in 1994 by Clay Parton, prior to Duster and Valium Aggelein. Clay's now iconic, signature sound was first explored with Calm on their debut 12" in 1995. With the absurdly long song titles and memorable instrumentals, the band remained unknown and nearly forgotten for many years. Until Duster's unexpected upswing in popular helped them ascend from total obscurity. This is the story of Calm.
Footage of the band comes from The Numero Group
► Leave a like if you enjoyed! Also, subscribe to the channel! ► TWITTER: https://twitter.com/lifesurrealband ► INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/shawn.pc/?hl=en ► More music related content coming soon here on The Music Narrative

entry.title: Closer | The Story of Joy Division

media:group.media:title: Closer | The Story of Joy Division
media:group.media:description:
► Joy Division is one of the most iconic bands of all time, formed in 1976 Manchester. Ian Curtis, Bernard Sumner, Peter Hook and Stephen Morris were at the forefront of one of the most revolutionary music scenes ever, popularizing a new style. 1979's Unknown Pleasures and 1980's Closer have become essential albums for their innovation. Songs such as "Love Will Tear Us Apart", "Disorder" and "She's Lost Control" have been cemented in history as some of the most significant songs ever written. This is the story of Joy Division, a band that started off as punk, but quickly transcended that label, delving into new territory all together.
► Leave a like if you enjoyed! Also, subscribe to the channel! ► TWITTER: https://twitter.com/lifesurrealband ► INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/shawn.pc/?hl=en ► More music related content coming soon here on The Music Narrative

media:group.media:title: The Story of Unwound
media:group.media:description:
► In this week's video, I discuss the insanely influential post-hardcore and noise rock trio, Unwound. Formed in 1991, the band has released now iconic records such as Fake Train, New Plastic Ideas, Repetition and Leaves Turn Inside You. Being one of the most important acts to come from the indie label Kill Rock Stars, this is the story of Unwound. A band consisting of Justin Trosper, Vern Rumsey and Sara Lund that defined a generation of outcasts.

media:group.media:title: Exploring Duster's Unreleased Music
media:group.media:description:
► In this week's video, I dive into Duster's unreleased/unfinished music that has been floating around the internet for a while now. I talk about the band's fan made compilation albums such as "Experimental Dust", "Low Earth Orbit" and "Testphase, Tape One". Give 'em a listen, they're something really special.
Duster is Clay Parton, Canaan Dove Amber and Jason Albertini. The band is mostly known for their influential 1998 record "Stratosphere" along with songs like "Gold Dust" & "Inside Out".
► LINK TO THE STORY OF DUSTER: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LG4dT70XVJQ&t=3s
► Leave a like if you enjoyed! Also, subscribe to the channel! ► TWITTER: https://twitter.com/lifesurrealband ► INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/shawn.pc/?hl=en ► More music related content coming soon here on The Music Narrative

media:group.media:title: The Story of American Football
media:group.media:description:
► In today's video, I discuss American Football, a trailblazer of the subgenre known as Midwest Emo. Largely known for their track "Never Meant" along with their 1999 self titled album, the band broke up for many years. Their return over a decade later is something neither the fans nor the band ever saw coming. This is the story of American Football.

entry.title: The Story of Death Cab for Cutie

media:group.media:title: The Story of Death Cab for Cutie
media:group.media:description:
► In this week's video, I discuss the career of indie rock legends, Death Cab for Cutie. Led by Ben Gibbard, the group began in Bellingham, Washington in 1997 as a solo project. Chris Walla, Nick Harmer and Nathan Good would join soon later and thus, Death Cab was born. With 9 studio albums, including classics such as Transatlanticism (2003) and Plans (2005), this is the story of Death Cab for Cutie. A band that continues to amaze 25 years deep into their journey.
► Leave a like if you enjoyed! Also, subscribe to the channel! ► TWITTER: https://twitter.com/lifesurrealband ► INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/shawn.pc/?hl=en ► More music related content coming soon here on The Music Narrative
#DeathCabForCutie

media:group.media:title: 10 Essential Slowcore Albums
media:group.media:description:
► In today's video, I discuss 10 essential Slowcore albums that have been largely influential within the subgenre. Ranging from the melancholic lows of Codeine to the spacey soundscapes of Duster, Slowcore is a fascinating subgenre of indie rock that is severely underappreciated. So, without further ado, here are my picks for some of the most important Slowcore albums of all time.
► Leave a like if you enjoyed! Also, subscribe to the channel! ► TWITTER: https://twitter.com/lifesurrealband ► INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/shawn.pc/?hl=en ► More music related content coming soon here on The Music Narrative

media:group.media:title: The Story of Galaxie 500
media:group.media:description:
► Today, I discuss legendary Slowcore/Alternative band, Galaxie 500. While only around from 1987-1991, the band's icon status has been solidified for many years. With such records as Today (1988), On Fire (1989) and This Is Our Music (1990), let's dive into the story of Galaxie 500, a trio of subtle intensity and beautiful simplicity.

media:group.media:title: The Story of Nick Drake
media:group.media:description:
► In this week's video, I discuss legendary musician Nick Drake (1948-1974). I dive into Nick's early musical upbringing and chronicle his short, but iconic career. With records such as Bryter Layter (1971) and Pink Moon (1972), this is the story of Nick Drake, an artist of authenticity and passion.

entry.title: Life Surreal EP Release Livestream + 500 Subscribers!

media:group.media:title: Life Surreal EP Release Livestream + 500 Subscribers!
media:group.media:description:
My friend Matt & I have a band called Life Surreal and our debut EP, Dead Language, is out today! So we're just gonna do a casual stream talking about the songs, our future music and the channel.
► BANDCAMP: https://lifesurreal.bandcamp.com/releases ► SPOTIFY: https://open.spotify.com/album/6tsGKm383nqr7G5IksWczW ► TWITTER: https://twitter.com/lifesurrealband ► INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/shawn.pc/?hl=en

media:group.media:title: Life Surreal - Dead Language (FULL EP)
media:group.media:description:
Life Surreal - Dead Language. TRACKLIST: 1. Silent Tongue; 0:00 2. Bleed Me Dry; 2:11 3. Bury My Head; 4:33 4. Far From Fiction; 6:49 5. George Died Underwater; 10:29
This is our first EP and it's definitely not perfect. But we're mostly proud of it and excited to make more music, learn more and improve. We'll be livestreaming 12.18.20 at 6:30 PM (EST) to talk more about our music and the channel. Hope to see some of you there!

media:group.media:title: The Story of Brand New
media:group.media:description:
► Today, I discuss the American rock band, Brand New. I cover their early career, all of their studio albums and finally, the 2017 allegations against Jesse Lacey that would lead to their demise. This is the story of Brand New, an incredibly successful band formed in 2000, whose legacy is now overshadowed by controversy.
I start talking about the 2017 Jesse Lacey allegations at 11:24 just for reference.
► Leave a like if you enjoyed! Also, subscribe to the channel! ► TWITTER: https://twitter.com/lifesurrealband ► INSTAGRAM: https://www.instagram.com/shawn.pc/?hl=en ► More music related content coming soon here on The Music Narrative

entry.title: The Saddest Album Ever (A Crow Looked at Me)

media:group.media:title: The Saddest Album Ever (A Crow Looked at Me)
media:group.media:description:
◆ In this week's video, I discuss Phil Elverum's project, Mount Eerie. Particularly 2017's landmark album, A Crow Looked at Me. Following the death of Phil's wife, Geneviève Castrée, due to cancer at 35, he looked to music as a coping mechanism. The grief Phil endured turned into a record, detailing the complex feelings one encounters after loss. This is a tribute to Phil, Geneviève and their daughter. A Crow Looked at Me is genuinely the saddest album I've ever heard, but it's essential listening. Hope you appreciate the video. Rest in peace, Geneviève. 1981-2016
Also, I ran into multiple problems in the audio department for this particular video, so please excuse the minor inconsistencies.
SONG USED | Sovereign by Kevin MacLeod Link: https://incompetech.filmmusic.io/song... License: http://creativecommons.org/licenses/b...
